Comparatives - Superlatives.question: Compare these items.
answers: The orange is big.
The watermelon is bigger.
The pumpkin is biggest.

Comparatives - Superlatives.question: Compare these items.
answers: The golden retriever is small.
The beagle is smaller.
The chihuahua is smallest.

Comparatives - Superlatives.question: Compare these items.
answers: The sprout is tall.
The medium sunflower is taller.
The tall sunflower is tallest.

Comparatives - Superlatives.question: Compare these items.
answers: The crayon is long.
The pencil is longer.
The ruler is longest.

Comparatives - Superlatives.question: Compare these items.
answers: The ribbon is wide.
The scarf is wider.
The beach towel is widest.

Comparatives - Superlatives.question: Compare these items.
answers: The thin book is thick.
The medium book is thicker.
The dictionary is thickest.

Comparatives - Superlatives.question: Compare these items.
answers: Four strawberries is many.
The pile of strawberries is more.
The overflowing bowl has the most.

Comparatives - Superlatives.question: Compare these items.
answers: The full box has few.
Some crayons is fewer.
Two crayons is fewest.

Comparatives - Superlatives.question: Compare these items.
answers: The empty glass is full.
The half-full glass is fuller.
The full glass is fullest.

Comparatives - Superlatives.question: Compare these items.
answers: The full basket is empty.
The half-empty basket is emptier.
The empty basket is emptiest.

Comparatives - Superlatives.question: Compare these items.
answers: The warm soup is hot.
The hot soup is hotter.
The very hot soup is hottest.

Comparatives - Superlatives.question: Compare these items.
answers: The cool water is cold.
The ice water is colder.
The frozen popsicle is coldest.

Comparatives - Superlatives.question: Compare these items.
answers: The paper is soft.
The cotton ball is softer.
The fluffy pillow is softest.

Comparatives - Superlatives.question: Compare these items.
answers: The bread is hard.
The apple is harder.
The rock is hardest.

Comparatives - Superlatives.question: Compare these items.
answers: The sandpaper is smooth.
The wooden table is smoother.
The glass marble is smoothest.

Comparatives - Superlatives.question: Compare these items.
answers: The flat paper is bumpy.
The bubble wrap is bumpier.
The sea shell is bumpiest.

Comparatives - Superlatives.question: Compare these items.
answers: The small spot is messy.
The food on face is messier.
Being covered in paint is messiest.

Comparatives - Superlatives.question: Compare these items.
answers: The muddy shoes are clean.
The dusty shoes are cleaner.
The sparkling shoes are cleanest.

Comparatives - Superlatives.question: Compare these items.
answers: The nightlight is bright.
The table lamp is brighter.
The sunshine is brightest.

Comparatives - Superlatives.question: Compare these items.
answers: The sunny room is dark.
The room at sunset is darker.
The dark room is darkest.

Comparatives - Superlatives.question: Compare these items.
answers: The turtle is fast.
The rabbit is faster.
The cheetah is fastest.

Comparatives - Superlatives.question: Compare these items.
answers: The bird is slow.
The cat is slower.
The snail is slowest.

Comparatives - Superlatives.question: Compare these items.
answers: A whisper is loud.
Talking is louder.
Shouting is loudest.

Comparatives - Superlatives.question: Compare these items.
answers: The drum is quiet.
Humming is quieter.
The sleeping bunny is quietest.

Comparatives - Superlatives.question: Compare these items.
answers: The feather is heavy.
The book is heavier.
The watermelon is heaviest.

Comparatives - Superlatives.question: Compare these items.
answers: The bowling ball is light.
The orange is lighter.
The balloon is lightest.

Comparatives - Superlatives.question: Compare these items.
answers: The dry towel is wet.
The damp towel is wetter.
The soaking wet towel is wettest.

Comparatives - Superlatives.question: Compare these items.
answers: The wet sponge is dry.
The damp sponge is drier.
The dry sponge is driest.

Comparatives - Superlatives.question: Compare these items.
answers: The flower is smelly.
The onions are smellier.
The garbage is smelliest.

Comparatives - Superlatives.question: Compare these items.
answers: The lemon is sweet.
The apple is sweeter.
The mango is sweetest.

questions.question: How are a towel and a blanket the same?
answers: They are both made of soft fabric.
They both keep you warm or dry.
They are both used in the home.

questions.question: How are they different?
answers: A towel is used to dry off after a bath.
A blanket is used to keep warm in bed.
Towels are smaller than blankets.

questions.question: How are a cup and a bowl the same?
answers: They are both containers for food or drinks.
They can both hold liquids.
They are both used at the table.

questions.question: How are they different?
answers: A cup is tall and has a handle.
A bowl is wide and shallow.
You drink from a cup but eat from a bowl.

questions.question: How are a chair and a couch the same?
answers: They are both furniture for sitting.
They both have seats and backs.
They are both found in homes.

questions.question: How are they different?
answers: A chair is for one person.
A couch can seat multiple people.
A couch is longer than a chair.

questions.question: How are a lamp and a flashlight the same?
answers: They both produce light.
They both help you see in the dark.
They both use electricity.

questions.question: How are they different?
answers: A lamp stays in one place.
A flashlight is portable.
A lamp plugs into the wall, a flashlight uses batteries.

questions.question: How are a pillow and a cushion the same?
answers: They are both soft and filled with stuffing.
They both provide comfort.
They are both used on furniture.

questions.question: How are they different?
answers: A pillow is used for sleeping.
A cushion is used for sitting.
Pillows are usually on beds, cushions on couches.

questions.question: How are a broom and a mop the same?
answers: They are both cleaning tools.
They both have long handles.
They are both used to clean floors.

questions.question: How are they different?
answers: A broom is used for sweeping dry dirt.
A mop is used for wet cleaning.
A broom has bristles, a mop has a sponge or cloth.

questions.question: How are a refrigerator and a freezer the same?
answers: They both keep food cold.
They are both kitchen appliances.
They both use electricity.

questions.question: How are they different?
answers: A refrigerator keeps food cool.
A freezer keeps food frozen.
A freezer is colder than a refrigerator.

questions.question: How are a bathtub and a shower the same?
answers: They are both used for bathing.
They both use water to get clean.
They are both found in bathrooms.

questions.question: How are they different?
answers: A bathtub holds water to soak in.
A shower sprays water from above.
You sit in a bathtub but stand in a shower.

questions.question: How are socks and shoes the same?
answers: They are both worn on feet.
They both protect your feet.
They are both clothing items.

questions.question: How are they different?
answers: Socks are soft and worn inside shoes.
Shoes are hard and worn outside.
Socks are made of fabric, shoes have soles.

questions.question: How are a hat and a helmet the same?
answers: They are both worn on the head.
They both cover your head.
They both come in different styles.

questions.question: How are they different?
answers: A hat is soft and for fashion or sun protection.
A helmet is hard and protects from injury.
Helmets are for safety, hats are for style.

questions.question: How are a jacket and a sweater the same?
answers: They are both worn on the upper body.
They both keep you warm.
They are both types of outerwear.

questions.question: How are they different?
answers: A jacket has a zipper or buttons in front.
A sweater is pulled over the head.
Jackets are often waterproof, sweaters are knitted.

questions.question: How are flip flops and sandals the same?
answers: They are both open shoes.
They are both worn in warm weather.
They both leave parts of your feet exposed.

questions.question: How are they different?
answers: Flip flops have a strap between the toes.
Sandals have straps around the foot.
Sandals often have more support than flip flops.

questions.question: How are a backpack and a tote bag the same?
answers: They are both bags for carrying things.
They both have handles or straps.
They both store personal items.

questions.question: How are they different?
answers: A backpack is worn on your back.
A tote bag is carried by hand or shoulder.
A backpack has two straps, a tote has one or two handles.

questions.question: How are an orange and an apple the same?
answers: They are both fruits.
They are both round in shape.
They are both healthy snacks.

questions.question: How are they different?
answers: An orange has a peel you remove.
An apple has edible skin.
An orange is citrus, an apple is not.

questions.question: How are bread and a tortilla the same?
answers: They are both made from flour.
They are both used to eat with other foods.
They are both baked or cooked.

questions.question: How are they different?
answers: Bread is thick and fluffy.
A tortilla is thin and flat.
Bread is sliced, a tortilla is folded.

questions.question: How are juice and a smoothie the same?
answers: They are both drinks made from fruits.
They are both healthy beverages.
They can both be served cold.

questions.question: How are they different?
answers: Juice is thin and clear.
A smoothie is thick and creamy.
Smoothies often have yogurt or milk added.

questions.question: How are rice and pasta the same?
answers: They are both carbohydrates.
They are both cooked in boiling water.
They are both served as side dishes.

questions.question: How are they different?
answers: Rice is a grain that grows in paddies.
Pasta is made from wheat flour.
Rice is small grains, pasta comes in many shapes.

questions.question: How are a cucumber and a bell pepper the same?
answers: They are both vegetables.
They can both be eaten raw.
They are both crunchy.

questions.question: How are they different?
answers: A cucumber is long and green.
A bell pepper is round and can be many colors.
A cucumber has seeds inside, a bell pepper is hollow.

questions.question: How are a cat and a dog the same?
answers: They are both pets.
They are both furry animals.
They both have four legs.

questions.question: How are they different?
answers: A cat meows and a dog barks.
Cats are more independent, dogs need more attention.
Dogs are usually bigger than cats.

questions.question: How are a bunny and a hamster the same?
answers: They are both small furry pets.
They both have soft fur.
They both eat vegetables.

questions.question: How are they different?
answers: A bunny has long ears.
A hamster has small round ears.
Bunnies hop, hamsters run.

questions.question: How are a dolphin and a whale the same?
answers: They are both marine mammals.
They both live in the ocean.
They both breathe air through blowholes.

questions.question: How are they different?
answers: A dolphin is much smaller than a whale.
Dolphins have pointed snouts.
Whales are the largest animals on Earth.

questions.question: How are a butterfly and a bird the same?
answers: They both have wings.
They can both fly.
They are both colorful.

questions.question: How are they different?
answers: A butterfly is an insect.
A bird has feathers and a beak.
Butterflies have antennae, birds do not.

questions.question: How are sand and water the same?
answers: They are both found at the beach.
They both feel nice to play in.
They are both part of nature.

questions.question: How are they different?
answers: Sand is solid and dry.
Water is liquid and wet.
You build with sand but swim in water.

questions.question: How are a surfboard and a boogie board the same?
answers: They are both used in the ocean.
They both help you ride waves.
They both float on water.

questions.question: How are they different?
answers: A surfboard is longer and you stand on it.
A boogie board is shorter and you lie on it.
Surfboards require more skill to ride.

questions.question: How are a seashell and a starfish the same?
answers: They are both found at the beach.
They both come from the ocean.
They are both collected as souvenirs.

questions.question: How are they different?
answers: A seashell is a hard shell from a mollusk.
A starfish is a living sea creature.
Starfish have arms, seashells are curved.

questions.question: How are a beach towel and a beach umbrella the same?
answers: They are both used at the beach.
They both help you stay comfortable.
They are both brought for beach trips.

questions.question: How are they different?
answers: A beach towel is for lying on or drying off.
A beach umbrella provides shade from the sun.
Towels are flat, umbrellas stand up.

questions.question: How are crayons and markers the same?
answers: They are both used for coloring.
They both come in many colors.
They are both art supplies.

questions.question: How are they different?
answers: Crayons are made of wax.
Markers use ink.
Markers have brighter colors than crayons.

questions.question: How are paint and glue the same?
answers: They are both used in art projects.
They both come in bottles.
They both start wet and dry.

questions.question: How are they different?
answers: Paint adds color to things.
Glue sticks things together.
Paint comes in many colors, glue is usually white or clear.

questions.question: How are a puzzle and building blocks the same?
answers: They are both toys with many pieces.
They both require thinking to use.
They are both fun to play with.

questions.question: How are they different?
answers: A puzzle pieces fit together to make a picture.
Building blocks stack to make structures.
Puzzles have one solution, blocks can build anything.

questions.question: How are sewing and knitting the same?
answers: They are both crafts that use thread or yarn.
They both create fabric items.
They both require practice and skill.

questions.question: How are they different?
answers: Sewing uses a needle and thread.
Knitting uses two needles and yarn.
Sewing joins fabric, knitting creates fabric.
